thread.title: Loretta Lynch Issues Rally Cry to Anti-Trump Protesters To Keep Marching
thread.title_full: Loretta Lynch Issues Rally Cry to Anti-Trump Protesters To Keep Marching

author: Gabrielle Cintorino
title: Loretta Lynch Issues Rally Cry to Anti-Trump Protesters To Keep Marching
text:
WATCH: Trey Gowdy Slams Media for Citing Anonymous Sources in Wiretapping Investigation 
“I know that this is a time of great fear and uncertainty for so many people,” she stated. “I know it’s a time of concern for people, who see our rights being assailed, being trampled on and even being rolled back. I know that this is difficult, but I remind you that this has never been easy. We have always had to work to move this country forward to achieve the great ideals of our Founding Fathers.” 
Then she spoke about violent protests , going into gruesome and specific detail. 
“It has been people, individuals who have banded together, ordinary people who simply saw what needed to be done and came together and supported those ideals, who have made the difference,” she continued. “They’ve marched, they’ve bled and yes, some of them died. This is hard. Every good thing is. We have done this before. We can do this again.”   
Was she really advocating for bleeding and death, or was this a case of very, very badly chosen words? Watch here and decide for yourself: 
According to WND , Lynch was expected to receive the Thomas Jefferson Foundation Medal of Law from the University of Virginia. 
It is truly mind-boggling that a woman who clearly encourages violence would be rewarded for her work. Standing in solidarity with peaceful protesters is one thing, but using death and blood as an example of a successful protest is not only unbecoming, but unbecoming of a woman who held a top position in a presidential cabinet.
